paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the BRCA2 c.8827C>T variant, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.phenotype_details: healthy person with no evidence of any associated disease
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Individual II: 1 was a healthy person with no evidence of any associated disease.
II: 5 and II: 6 both had bilateral breast cancer.
II: 5 and II: 6 both had bilateral breast cancer.
We first tested the mutational status of BRCA1 and BRCA2 in the proband (II: 7) with breast cancer.

functional_data.summary: The BRCA2 c.8827C>T mutation leads to a truncated BRCA2 protein, affecting its function.

variants.segregation_data: The BRCA2 mutation segregates with disease in the family.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence for pathogenicity based on functional assays and family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: The study suggests regular screening for malignancies in carriers of this mutation.
key_quotes: We identified a BRCA2 c.8827C>T nonsense mutation with a truncated BRCA2 protein in a consanguineous Chinese Han family.
Our study verified the function of this BRCA2 mutation site and provided a new target for the precise treatment of such patients.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
